column4: bleh, ive just installed ubuntu from dvd, but i cant connect to anything online except this irc server and the ubuntu site/wiki, any ideas?
i know :(
what do you get if you try to ping google? what about trying to ping your router?
have you got any other browsers to try with?
telnet www.google.com 80
that connects
well then, at least you web browing needs are taken care of ;)
have you done any experimental firewalling stuff?
sounds like a network issue, but I can't understand where...it's a default breezy install (plus non-net-related packages)?
if you do a GET when you telnet www.google.com 80, do you get the homepage?
what is your network likes
1 adsl modem then a router, its worked fine with everything else ive thrown at it though
but if you type in www.yahoo.com to firefox, you get nothing? what if you type http://216.109.118.77 ?
both bring up "yahoo!" as the title, but then dont display anything else (loading anim)
wget www.google.com (I'm not sure if wget is on the default install)
can you rerun dhclient on your main interface?
how?
from a terminal, sudo dhclient eth0 (or whatever your main interface is called)
restart firefox to start clean
done, its got as far as the favicon now
i got it working :)
sorry it was so hard :-/ still all's well that something something
was my adsl modem, turns out it doesnt like ipv6
ooh, nice and obscure
